facts: The first human-made object to reach space was the German V-2 rocket in 1944, flying above the edge of the atmosphere.
In 1957, Sputnik 1 became the first artificial satellite, proving that objects could orbit Earth.
Yuri Gagarin orbited Earth in 1961, becoming the first person to travel into space and return safely.
The Apollo 11 mission in 1969 landed the first humans on the Moon, and the astronauts brought back rocks for scientists to study.
Voyager 1, launched in 1977, has traveled farther than any other spacecraft and is now in interstellar space beyond the main region of the Sunâ€™s influence.
The International Space Station is a huge laboratory that orbits Earth about every 90 minutes, letting astronauts do experiments in microgravity.
Rovers like Curiosity and Perseverance explore Mars by driving on its surface, taking photos, analyzing rocks, and searching for signs of past water.
sources_hint: For verification, see NASA (missions, ISS, Mars rovers), ESA educational pages, and Britannica entries on Sputnik, Gagarin, and Apollo 11.
